author.name: Archaeo - Histories
author.description: History is an unending dialogue between present and the past, that's why few pages of history give more insight than all the metaphysical volumes.

html:
Wall of Fresco Briseis taken away from Achilles; from house of tragic poet, Pompeii.

Achilles sitting in his tent, Briseis is led out of tent (to Agamemnon), in presence of many Greek heroes. 

Museo Archeologico Nazionale, Napoli 

#archaeohistories https://t.co/5frRV4XPkI

author.name: Journal of Art in Society
author.description: Philip McCouat also writes in-depth articles on art, history and social change in the Journal of Art in Society at https://t.co/E4Lj24cgQi

html: Bernadino Luini was a contemporary of Leonardo da Vinci ~ here’s a detail from his Madonna with Sleeping Child (1532) and, at R, his Figure of Saint with Palm Frond, originally attributed to Leonardo. This work emerged only recently, after being unseen since 1865 https://t.co/YiCFQK68ds

author.name: Dr Crom
author.description: Classicist, archaeologist, sci-fi and horror nerd and, most importantly, ginger. Oh, and... "Ph'nglui mglw'nafh Cthulhu R'lyeh wgah'nagl fhtagn". #EdgyPedlar

html: A beautiful funerary portrait on a mummy shroud from Antinoe of an individual dubbed Ammonios, ca. Mid-3rd Century AD. Heavily restored, but the piece retains the original control of framing. #Archaeology #Art\n\nImage: Louvre Collections (P 215). Link - https://t.co/Cyimzs7juU https://t.co/3O8cbxV9UP

author.name: 💞LOVELY SPAIN🇪🇸
author.description: Account dedicated to Spain. Cities, villages, monuments, culture and nature. ❤💛❤

html: The main altarpiece of the Seville Cathedral is a gigantic work of art that was begun by the Spanish-Flemish sculptor Pedro Dancart in 1481. It is considered the largest altarpiece in Christianity. It was carried out over more than 80 years, being completely finished in 1564. ✨ https://t.co/dI9xggiCbD

author.name: Archaeo - Histories
author.description: History is an unending dialogue between present and the past, that's why few pages of history give more insight than all the metaphysical volumes.

html:
An Etruscan bronze figurine depicting Sleep (Hypnos) and Death (Thanatos) carrying away Sarpedon of Lykia, son of Zeus, after he was slain by Patroclus, friend of Achilles, during Trojan War, as recounted in Illiad.

This piece was made between 400-380 BC.

MET Museum https://t.co/yDkFzUjpPQ

author.name: Alison Fisk
author.description: Recent MA in Archaeological Practice @Birkbeckuol. Volunteer @PCAarchaeology & @HamHouseNT. Here for the archaeology.  Also at @AlisonFisk@archaeo.social.

html:
Astounding #IceAge art! A mammoth figurine carved from mammoth ivory about 40,000 years ago! 🦣❤️ 

Sculpted using flint tools, this mammoth is one of mankind’s oldest works of figurative art. From the Vogelherd Cave, Swabian Jura, Germany. Photo my own.

#Archaeology https://t.co/nMGdUqDo1I

author.name: ArchaeoHistories
author.description: History is an unending dialogue between present and the past, that's why few pages of history give more insight than all the metaphysical volumes.

html:
The carp in the Basilica cistern in Istanbul is the offspring of the Byzantine carp that originated from the river water, carried here through the canals from Belgrade Forest.

İstanbul - Türkiye

#archaeohistories https://t.co/1V2IFTORx6

Coin of Gallic Veneti; (5th-1st century BC)
